title: 47% of developers say bad project managers are their biggest problem
content:
This article was originally published on .cult by Hannah Augur. .cult is a Berlin-based community platform for developers. We write about all things career-related, make original documentaries and share heaps of other untold developer stories from around the world. What’s the first thing that people think of when they hear the word ‘developer’? For many people, it’s probably ‘money’ or maybe companies like ‘Facebook’ or ‘Google’. However, these topics don’t really reflect the work that developers do or the ways in which they view their career or their life. In fact, while only 8% of developers in Europe want to…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: The new Dev Career Ambitions survey by .cult is out with some interesting findings. Find what developers in Europe want out of their career.
